alert.note: Alert for Carter; Greenup (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 2:25PM EST until February 04 at 3:30PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Kentucky... Little Sandy River At Grayson affecting Carter and Greenup Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Little Sandy River At Grayson. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Affects the buildings next to river gage. Also, water starts to flow onto Route 773 and in the Dixie Park area just past I-64 bridge. State Route 1910 floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 21.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:00 PM EST Friday was 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this afternoon to 17.1 feet and then begin rising tomorrow morning. It will then rise again to 17.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will fall to 15.5 feet and then begin rising early Tuesday morning. It will then rise again to 15.9 feet Tuesday evening. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.6 feet on 03/11/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 330 PM EST.
